"Are you even...human?": "You... You're Emperor Verun's younger brother Elmir! You should be dead!"
"...Ha, you are well-informed. I'd expect nothing less from Es-Ars. Even we could not escape your notice."
"And yet... You knew nothing of this, did you?"
"Kuh!"
"Clarissa!"
"Flo!"
"Tch, out of the way!"
"Head of Es-Ars, Symbol of this country. It is your right to do as you wish with this land."
"Did you not desire to play more? Did you not have things you still wished to do? Then, you ought do them to your heart's content."
"You hold that power within you. And soon, you will know exactly how to make use of it."
"What...? Use my...power...?"
"That's right. The memory of how to do so should be sleeping within you."
"Why don't I help you remember?"
"Flo! Flo!"
"Afterwards, as if he were crafting clay dolls, Flo called forth Demons and Devil Castles until everything was as you saw."
"...All I could do was flee. When I saw the look on his face as he turned to me, that was all I could do..."
"Clarissa..."
"So the Emperor of Verun's younger brother, Elmir, is the one who did this to Flo..."
"But I thought he was killed by Marge in Epic..."
"Did he survive?"
"Is it an impostor?"
"...I don't know. We just don't have enough information to tell whether he survived or if someone's impersonating him."
"Clarissa, what is the current situation within Es-Ars?"
"...I do not know. I was only just barely able to escape through the secret passages."
"...However, the capital is swarming with Demons. If it is not already lost, it won't be long before it is."
"The Devil Castles and Demons of Es-Ars all originate from Flo, and they are still being created as we speak."
"If left unchecked, the country will be filled to the brim with them. Filled with Demons searching for playmates."
"If we're going to stop them... Our only option is to stop their source, Flo."
"Guardian of Cuent... I beg of you, please lend us your strength."
"With that same power that saved Verun and Epic, once more... Somehow... Some way..."
"...Save Flo."
"Of course"
"...Can he even be saved?"
"...It's true that we can't just leave things as they are. I have no objection to helping."
"However..."
"...I don't know. But if even the slightest possibility exists..."
"...I ask not that you save his life. Only that you save his soul."
"He sacrificed everything for his country... We cannot let him destroy it."
"...How can we stop him?"
"As you know from your battles, the Demons revive at an overwhelming rate, no matter how many you slay."
"This nightmare will not end unless you strike at the heart of the problem."
"So you're saying we need to take out the core."
"Correct. There exists a passage from here that leads directly to it."
"It has a far greater chance of success than attempting to fight them head-on."
"Nevertheless, there are likely to be a far greater number of enemies lying in wait..."
"...If they are acting in accordance with Flo's desire for someone to play with, then there is a way."
"We will have Cuent's armies assault Es-Ars and draw their attention with a widespread border skirmish. They will be forced to engage in a battle of attrition."
"During that time, the Guardian will strike. They will eliminate the core, and stop the hordes from multiplying. Is that acceptable?"
"Understood"
"...It'll be dangerous"
"...Well then, we shall go our separate ways this time. I will pray for your success, and do my utmost to fulfil my own duties."
"That will be true for the both of us. Perhaps I have matured, to have not simply chosen to accompany you."
"Queen Harriet of Cuent... Noble Guardian... You have my deepest gratitude."
